bioghist.p: Jean Martin Buche (1929-1998) was a missionary in India, teaching at the Avalon School (UPCNA) in Pathankot in the 1950s. She was married to the Reverend Robert H. Buche (1905-1992), a Presbyterian minister who served at the Trinity Presbyterian Church in Manhattan from 1938 to 1970. He was also chaplain of the St. George Society of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey.

scopecontent.p: This collection includes a photograph album documenting a 1972 trip made by the Buches to India mission sites including the Avalon School and Christian Medical Center; various publications documenting the UPCNA's India and Pakistan missions and non-church publications on the Sikhs; and two photo albums from India, one from 1958-1961 and one from 1972, showing church members, schoolchildren, village scenes, architecture, and animals. Also included are personal papers of Jean Martin Buche, which include photographs, slides, photograph albums, publications, and a 1967 manuscript by Buche on the languages of India. Additionally there are some photographs and printed material related to the Avalon Girls' High School in Pathankot, Punjab, India.
